evidence_collected.name: Phantom Accounts
evidence_collected.description: Complex financial scheme involving mirror accounts and delayed transfers designed to hide money movement

evidence_collected.name: Threatening Message
evidence_collected.description: Marcus sent client an urgent message demanding they meet at his house that night to 'resolve the situation permanently'

evidence_collected.name: Locked Office Mystery
evidence_collected.description: Client found Marcus's office door locked from inside with Marcus already dead, but someone else had to have been there

evidence_collected.name: Key Access List
evidence_collected.description: Three people had emergency keys: client, Marcus's assistant Victoria Chen, and business partner Robert Hayes - all trusted with financial access

evidence_collected.name: Victoria's Recent Behavior
evidence_collected.description: Marcus's assistant had been acting strangely, working late hours and asking unusual questions about client accounts

evidence_collected.name: Victoria's Personal Motive
evidence_collected.description: Victoria had been desperately trying to secure her sick mother's medical treatment and saw the phantom accounts as her only financial salvation

evidence_collected.name: Victoria's Technical Knowledge
evidence_collected.description: As Marcus's assistant, Victoria had complete access to client systems and understood the phantom account mechanisms better than anyone except Marcus himself

evidence_collected.name: Medical Bills Timeline
evidence_collected.description: Victoria's mother needed ,000 for experimental cancer treatment with a 6-week deadline - exactly matching the phantom account discovery timeline

evidence_collected.name: Window Anchor System
evidence_collected.description: Victoria used climbing equipment to rappel from Marcus's second-floor office window, then pulled the rope up to create the locked room illusion

evidence_collected.name: Hospital Disposal Theory
evidence_collected.description: Victoria likely disposed of climbing equipment at the hospital where her mother was receiving treatment - a place she visits regularly on her 'journey' to save her mother
